body:
What stops nodes from fusing across blocks? Fusing across blocks is not always safe since it may try to move a producer into a consumer that is only executed conditionally (or executed multiple times, which is a perf bug). 
I believe we need to add a check into all `isFusable` functions (and other places where we move instructions around) that the two operations are in the same blocks.
